main_text:
Middle Knowledge
7. Conclusion

There are several ways to try to resolve the problem of prophecy that
is the focus of most philosophical debate, which arises in cases where
a future contingent event is predicted. The approaches discussed here
possess various strengths and weaknesses. The question of prophecy has
been receiving increased attention as the debate over the extent of
God’s knowledge has become more widely discussed in recent work
in the philosophy of religion. As a result, one could reasonably
predict (prophesy?) that philosophical arguments concerning these
matters will continue indefinitely into the future.
